Building here: https://jenkins.confluent.io/view/All/job/system-test-kafka-branch-builder-2/176/console

Kicked off https://jenkins.confluent.io/job/system-test-kafka-branch-builder/681/ to get a full test of the suite, should also run the test that exhibited this issue with `--repeat N` for a reasonable number of N to try reproducing after this patch.

Thanks for the PR, good catch. I think I prefer your alternative solution, the current solution seems a bit odd.
Yeah, I agree with Ismael. Either that or we should consider renaming `hasCollision` to make the usage clearer.
LGTM. Merged to trunk and 0.10.2.

Thanks @ijuma 
The reasons why I had over looked the mentioned problems with having a common build output directory between gradle and eclipse were
* A clean build resolved the problems in Eclipse and well as Gradle. I do it often in Eclipse when things look messed up.
* Keeping common output folders helped me get the Eclipse dev setup working.
* I have always had common output folders between maven and eclipse.

All the same I will look into the possibility getting my setup to work with the following changes from your review suggestions
1. Having a separate output folder for eclipse (say build_eclipse)
2. Refactoring the in-line instructions

And of course comments :-)

Updated this. @enothereska @dguy @guozhangwang
@guozhangwang could you have a look please? This needs to go in before code freeze. Also in 0.10.2

@hachikuji Thanks for the patch. I took a quick look and the Listener approach looks reasonable to me. I am currently traveling in China so my response might be delayed a little. I'll make a full pass tomorrow.

Test PASSed (JDK 8 and Scala 2.12).
Awesome, thanks @mjsax LGTM

@mjsax thanks for review. I have added some tests. 
Basically, I added some tuples with `null` values to respective test classes. However I got failing tests from `KtableSourceTest` class. So, I had to remove `null` keys from `KtableSource.process` as otherwise the tests were failing. However, the important point is that, now that we changed `KtableSource.process`, the changes to `KTableKTableLeftJoin`, `KTableKTableJoin` and etc. does not matter. So, even if we throw exception  (when we encounter null keys) in corresponding classes, the null keys will be eliminated in `KtableSource` class.
Minor nits, otherwise LGTM, thanks @mjsax
